margot 0.2.1.9

Create Summary Tables for Longitudinal Data

margot_summary_tables.Rd

This function creates three summary tables (baseline, exposure, and outcome) for longitudinal data using gtsummary and janitor, and provides additional summary statistics.

Usage

margot_summary_tables(
  data,
  baseline_wave,
  exposure_waves,
  outcome_wave,
  name_exposure,
  name_exposure_cat = NULL,
  baseline_vars,
  outcome_vars,
  extra_vars = c("id", "wave", "year_measured", "not_lost", "sample_weights"),
  baseline_labels = NULL,
  exposure_labels = NULL,
  outcome_labels = NULL
)

Arguments

data

A data frame containing the longitudinal data.

baseline_wave

A string specifying the baseline wave (e.g., "2020").

exposure_waves

A vector of strings or a single comma-separated string specifying the exposure wave(s) (e.g., c("2021", "2022") or "2021,2022").

outcome_wave

A string specifying the outcome wave (e.g., "2022").

name_exposure

A string specifying the name of the exposure variable.

name_exposure_cat

Optional. A string specifying the name of the categorical exposure variable. Default is NULL.

baseline_vars

A vector of strings specifying the baseline variables.

outcome_vars

A vector of strings specifying the outcome variables.

extra_vars

Optional. A vector of strings specifying additional variables to include. Default is c("id", "wave", "year_measured", "not_lost", "sample_weights").

baseline_labels

Optional. A named list of custom labels for baseline variables.

exposure_labels

Optional. A named list of custom labels for exposure variables.

outcome_labels

Optional. A named list of custom labels for outcome variables.

Value

A list containing:

baseline_table

Summary of baseline variables

exposure_table

Summary of exposure variables by wave

outcome_table

Summary of outcome variables by wave

n_participants

Total number of unique participants

exposure_summary

A list of exposure summaries for each wave
